DS osudio napad Dmitrovića na Kišjuhasa

01 Nov 2019, 19:30

Gradski odbor Demokratske stranke (DS) u Novom Sadu najoštrije je danas osudio šovinistički napad novinara Ratka Dmitrovića na docenta Filozofskog fakulteta u Novom Sadu i kolumnistu dnevnog lista "Danas" Alekseja Kišjuhasa."Nasrtaj Dmitrovića putem društvene mreže Tviter, u kojem je poznatog novosadskog sociologa i univerzitetskog predavača nazvao psihopatom, ustašoidom, srbofom i drugim pogrdnim izrazima, predstavlja očigledan slučaj govora mržnje u javnom prostoru zbog kojeg bi morale da reaguju i sudske vlasti koje su dužne da pokrenu zakonom predvidjen postupak protiv Dmitrovića", naveo je DS u saopštenju za javnost.Demokrate su ocenile da je Kišjuhas postao meta uvreda i napada zbog svojih stavova iznetih u javnosti na koje kao intelektualac i punopravni gradjanin ove zemlje ima apsolutno pravo, a koji očigledno ne odgovaraju vladajućem režimu i njegovim pristalicama."Nažalost, Dmitrovićev šovinistički narativ u obračunu sa Kišjuhasom je postao dominantan u današnjoj Srbiji u kojoj je režim Aleksandra Vučića oslobodio svoje sledbenike i abonente svake odgovornosti za učinjena dela i javno izgovorene reči. Verbalno nasilje kojem je pribegao dugogodišnji glavni urednik Večernjih novosti i saradnik u drugim dnevnim i periodičnim listovima, medjutim, ne može i ne sme ostati samo na verbalnoj osudi zgranutog dela javnosti. Pridružujemo se zahtevima da Dmitrović zbog svog šovinističkog ispada bude osudjen i u sudskim institucijama u skladu sa zakonima ove zemlje", piše u saopštenju.

DS condemns Dmitrovic's attack on Kishjuhas

01 Nov 2019, 18:30

The Novi Sad City Democratic Party (DS) city committee has most strongly condemned the chauvinistic attack by journalist Ratko Dmitrovic on an assistant professor at the Faculty of Philosophy in Novi Sad and columnist for the daily Aleksei Kisjuhas. "Nasrtaj Dmitrovic through a social networking site in Novi Sad. and called the university lecturer a psychopath, an Ustashoid, a Serb and other derogatory expressions, is an obvious case of hate speech in a public space that would have to be reacted by the judicial authorities, which are obliged to initiate the lawsuit against Dmitrovic, "the DS said in a press release. .Democrats have estimated that Kishjuhas has become the target of insults and attacks because of his public views, to which he, as an intellectual and a full citizen of this country, has an absolute right, which clearly does not correspond to the ruling regime and its supporters. "Unfortunately, Dmitrovic's chauvinistic narrative in the showdown with Kijujuhas he became dominant n in today's Serbia, in which the regime of Aleksandar Vucic relieved his followers and subscribers of all responsibility for the acts done and the words spoken publicly. The verbal violence resorted to by the longtime editor-in-chief of Vecernje Novosti and a contributor to other daily and periodical newspapers, however, cannot and should not remain solely on the verbal condemnation of a disgusted section of the public. We join the demand that Dmitrovic be convicted in judicial institutions in accordance with the laws of this country for his chauvinistic outburst, "the statement reads.
